snippet: The structure has become a favored spot for drug deals and neighborhood drama, angering locals who have been trying for years to get it removed.
abstract: Harlem residents call for scaffolding at corner of Lenox Avenue and 123rd Street to be removed, as structure enters second decade since erected; sidewalk shed is used as a place to urinate, have occasional outdoor sex and indulge in drug deals; Mayor Bill de Blasio has promised to remove unneeded scaffolding around city-owned buildings but private housing residents seek similar relief.
lead_paragraph: The structure has become a favored spot for drug deals and neighborhood drama, angering locals who have been trying for years to get it removed.

headline.main: 10 Years On, Scaffolding in Harlem Is Still a Shelter for Noxious Acts
headline.print_headline: 10 Years On, Still a Shelter for Noxious Acts
